title: The Dreaming. Series 3
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Animation (Cinematography)
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Animators
abstract: 4 tapes, 1 booklet. Tape 1: The Making of the series (12 mins.)--Tape 2: 4 stories (each 11-13 mins. duration) Min-na-wee ; Nudjanuka ; How the waratah became red ; How the water got to the plains (48 mins. total)--Tape 3: 4 stories (each 11-15 mins. duration) Ngarntipi ; How the brolga became a bird ; The emu and the jabiru ; The coming of a warrior (51 total mins.)--Tape 4: 5 stories (each 11-14 mins. duration) Manala the monstor cod ; The snake and the goanna ; Tuggan Tuggan ; Biami and Marmoo ; Buduk and Bulaytj Bulaytj (51 mins. total) Booklet: Teacher's guide
description: Series three of "The Dreaming" consists of thirteen of a total of 78 short animations of Aboriginal Dreaming stories that make up the six part series. This ambitious project was produced by Aboriginal Nations, an independent animation company committed to employing Aboriginal animators. With reference to an intellectual property protocol developed by the company, the stories were sourced from Aboriginal communities, and the permission to tell and animate them was obtained from community elders. The soundtracks utilise the voices of Aboriginal actors and feature original music by Aboriginal composers. A comprehensive teachers guide and supporting videos introducing the Dreaming and offering insights into the storytelling and animation process are also included.
